intro: Triolena lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf triolena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found near water bodies. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
